description: Provides information about other Google APIs, such as what APIs are available, the resource, and method details for each API.
name: discovery

fields.description: Selector specifying which fields to include in a partial response.

key.description: API key. Your API key identifies your project and provides you with API access, quota, and reports. Required unless you provide an OAuth 2.0 token.

oauth_token.description: OAuth 2.0 token for the current user.

prettyPrint.description: Returns response with indentations and line breaks.

quotaUser.description: An opaque string that represents a user for quota purposes. Must not exceed 40 characters.

getRest.description: Retrieve the description of a particular version of an api.

list.description: Retrieve the list of APIs supported at this endpoint.

name.description: Only include APIs with the given name.

preferred.description: Return only the preferred version of an API.

discoveryVersion.description: Indicate the version of the Discovery API used to generate this doc.

items.description: The individual directory entries. One entry per api/version pair.

discoveryLink.description: A link to the discovery document.

discoveryRestUrl.description: The URL for the discovery REST document.

documentationLink.description: A link to human readable documentation for the API.

icons.description: Links to 16x16 and 32x32 icons representing the API.

labels.description: Labels for the status of this API, such as labs or deprecated.

preferred.description: True if this version is the preferred version to use.

$ref.description: A reference to another schema. The value of this property is the "id" of another schema.

additionalProperties.description: If this is a schema for an object, this property is the schema for any additional properties with dynamic keys on this object.

required.description: A list of methods for which this property is required on requests.

default.description: The default value of this property (if one exists).

enum.description: Values this parameter may take (if it is an enum).

enumDescriptions.description: The descriptions for the enums. Each position maps to the corresponding value in the "enum" array.

format.description: An additional regular expression or key that helps constrain the value. For more details see: http://tools.ietf.org/html/draft-zyp-json-schema-03#section-5.23

items.description: If this is a schema for an array, this property is the schema for each element in the array.

location.description: Whether this parameter goes in the query or the path for REST requests.

maximum.description: The maximum value of this parameter.

minimum.description: The minimum value of this parameter.

pattern.description: The regular expression this parameter must conform to. Uses Java 6 regex format: http://docs.oracle.com/javase/6/docs/api/java/util/regex/Pattern.html

additionalProperties.description: A single property of this object. The value is itself a JSON Schema object describing this property.

properties.description: If this is a schema for an object, list the schema for each property of this object.

readOnly.description: The value is read-only, generated by the service. The value cannot be modified by the client. If the value is included in a POST, PUT, or PATCH request, it is ignored by the service.

repeated.description: Whether this parameter may appear multiple times.

type.description: The value type for this schema. A list of values can be found here: http://tools.ietf.org/html/draft-zyp-json-schema-03#section-5.1

variant.description: In a variant data type, the value of one property is used to determine how to interpret the entire entity. Its value must exist in a map of descriminant values to schema names.

discriminant.description: The name of the type discriminant property.

map.description: The map of discriminant value to schema to use for parsing..

basePath.description: [DEPRECATED] The base path for REST requests.

baseUrl.description: [DEPRECATED] The base URL for REST requests.

batchPath.description: The path for REST batch requests.

canonicalName.description: Indicates how the API name should be capitalized and split into various parts. Useful for generating pretty class names.

discoveryVersion.description: Indicate the version of the Discovery API used to generate this doc.

documentationLink.description: A link to human readable documentation for the API.

exponentialBackoffDefault.description: Enable exponential backoff for suitable methods in the generated clients.

features.description: A list of supported features for this API.

icons.description: Links to 16x16 and 32x32 icons representing the API.

labels.description: Labels for the status of this API, such as labs or deprecated.

ownerDomain.description: The domain of the owner of this API. Together with the ownerName and a packagePath values, this can be used to generate a library for this API which would have a unique fully qualified name.

ownerName.description: The name of the owner of this API. See ownerDomain.

packagePath.description: The package of the owner of this API. See ownerDomain.

parameters.description: Common parameters that apply across all apis.

protocol.description: The protocol described by this document.

additionalProperties.description: An individual resource description. Contains methods and sub-resources related to this resource.

rootUrl.description: The root URL under which all API services live.

servicePath.description: The base path for all REST requests.

etagRequired.description: Whether this method requires an ETag to be specified. The ETag is sent as an HTTP If-Match or If-None-Match header.

httpMethod.description: HTTP method used by this method.

id.description: A unique ID for this method. This property can be used to match methods between different versions of Discovery.

accept.description: MIME Media Ranges for acceptable media uploads to this method.

maxSize.description: Maximum size of a media upload, such as "1MB", "2GB" or "3TB".

resumable.description: Supports the Resumable Media Upload protocol.

multipart.description: True if this endpoint supports uploading multipart media.

path.description: The URI path to be used for upload. Should be used in conjunction with the basePath property at the api-level.

simple.description: Supports uploading as a single HTTP request.

multipart.description: True if this endpoint supports upload multipart media.

path.description: The URI path to be used for upload. Should be used in conjunction with the basePath property at the api-level.

parameterOrder.description: Ordered list of required parameters, serves as a hint to clients on how to structure their method signatures. The array is ordered such that the "most-significant" parameter appears first.

additionalProperties.description: Details for a single parameter in this method.

parameters.description: Details for all parameters in this method.

path.description: The URI path of this REST method. Should be used in conjunction with the basePath property at the api-level.

$ref.description: Schema ID for the request schema.
Schema ID for the response schema.

scopes.description: OAuth 2.0 scopes applicable to this method.

supportsMediaDownload.description: Whether this method supports media downloads.

supportsMediaUpload.description: Whether this method supports media uploads.

useMediaDownloadService.description: Indicates that downloads from this method should use the download service URL (i.e. "/download"). Only applies if the method supports media download.

additionalProperties.description: Description for any methods on this resource.
Description for any sub-resources on this resource.

title: API Discovery Service
